lines.text:
[Crashing through the door of Arro's shack]
This is where you live?
Did you expect a royal palace?

[Frightened]
Salvatore, what do they want?

[Referring to an elderly worker whose hand was mangled]
How is he?

[Laconically]
Hands don't grow back.

[Referrinfg to Arro]
If that Ethipopian goes to work tomorrow, one by one they will go back with yours truly first in line.

[Walking back to work after a brief unch]
THese bastards treat s like animals. It's worse than prison.
To Hell with all of them!
Swear you won't work if we don't authorize it.
Are you going to authorize it?
Swear first!
I swear, Mr. Pautasso.

[Positively]
The scabs are being sent back to Saluzzo to prevent further incidents. I told you something would happen if we held out.
Sure, a man lost his life. Happy now? How many more do you want?
How'd you get messed up in all this?
Out of selfishness.
I don't understand.
Because I like it, and when you like something, it's not a sacrifoce, and to ensure someday that a girl like you...
What?
...won't have to make the choices you had to.

[Referring to the effectiveness of the strike while they're lying in bed]
It might even be impossible.
Then you're a lunatic and a scoundrel! Do you want to destroy us all
You expect to win the first time. That doesn't happen. That would be too easy, and you're not the first, you kow. This fight began with Spartacus.
Who's Spartacus?
I'll tell you some other time, but you have to hold out and make them pay, so they know the next time it'll be even worse. That in itself would be a victory - and don't hog the covers.
